ref.mixed-citation: As the text speaks of him as “the emperor’s son-in-law”, this must be a reference to Tsereng 策棱, who, in 1706, was married to the emperor’s tenth daughter, Princess Chunke 純愨 (1685 –1710), and not to the Zunghar general Cering Dondub, the brother of Tsewang Rabdan (1643–1727). Tsereng was an important Mongol general of the Borjigid clan.
